location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.432 of 1852, from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter enclosing a report from the British agent at Sharjah, Hajee Yacoob, sent to Kemball and dated 20 December 1852. Yacoob reports on recent rivalries between the Joasmee [Qasimi] and Beni Yas tribes on the Arab Coast. Yacoob states that the Sheikhs of Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi], Debai and Amulgavine [Umm al-Qaywayn] have agreed an alliance against Sheikh Sultan ben Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr] of Ra's al-Khaymah.
